intro: Hieracium bariegoi, commonly known as the Bariego hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, forming a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium bariegoi is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
